The hash set is the most used set implementation.
The main reason is because it's really fast.
You can see here the set interface has the methods add when you want to add an element
to the set, remove when you want to remove an element from the set, and contains when
you want to check if a particular element is already part of the set.
And so, in terms of big-o notation, this is as fast as it gets, right?
The drawback is that in terms of ordering, there's no guaranteed order.
So you just add these elements to your hash set, and you're not sure how they're going
to be stored and retrieved.
So you can see here the set of the set.
Now, if it is very important to you to have some sort of sorting, then you should be using
